page.title: 07Ecology 2: Flowers
page.content:
Common throughout the area are plants such as burnet, dandelion, foxglove, dog's mercury, lesser celandine, milkwort, lousewort, primrose, scabious, thyme and water crowfoot. In the upland areas and in woods and hedgerows are found golden saxifrage and moschatel. On wet ground bog asphodel, butterwort and sundew are common. Oxlip, early purple orchid, bird's eye primrose and meadow saxifrage are typical of the limestone areas; in hedgebanks toothwort, greater celandine and shining leaved cranesbill may be found.
Pond and River Life
Commonly found in the ponds and rivers of the area are: caddis fly, dragonfly frog, minnow, newt, toad, water boatman, water snail and water spider.
